content:
• Tuesday, February 14, 2012
  • INWK

    More on Innerworkings (NASDAQ:INWK): Q4 beats on revenue as net income jumped 63% Y/Y on a fifth...

    More on Innerworkings (NASDAQ:INWK): Q4 beats on revenue as net income jumped 63% Y/Y on a fifth straight quarter of record profit. Enterprise revenue growth also rose 31.7% over the year-ago period while transactional revenue growth jumped 42.0%. Shares +4.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 PM
  • EMKR

    Emcore (NASDAQ:EMKR) trades up during the post-session, largely in relief after reporting its...

    Emcore (NASDAQ:EMKR) trades up during the post-session, largely in relief after reporting its FQ1 earnings in-line with guidance. Q1 net revenue actually declined -28% Y/Y, primarily due to contractor supply problems stemming from the floods in Thailand last year that forced the company to suspend operations. Shares +4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACPW

    More on Active Power (NASDAQ:ACPW): Q4 misses estimates across the board as losses deepened on...

    More on Active Power (NASDAQ:ACPW): Q4 misses estimates across the board as losses deepened on lower systems revenue and a decline in margins. The company also sees its Q1 EPS at the low end of forecasts, now expecting a loss of $0.01 - $0.03 per share. The Street is looking for a a loss of $0.01 per share. Shares -22% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 PM
  • RENN

    Renren (NYSE:RENN), a beneficiary of Facebook IPO hype, falls 6.3% AH after preannouncing Q4...

    Renren (NYSE:RENN), a beneficiary of Facebook IPO hype, falls 6.3% AH after preannouncing Q4 revenue of $31M-$33M ($32.6M consensus), and an operating loss of $15M-$17M (suggests EPS worse than the -$0.01 consensus). Renren's guidance for 2012 revenue growth of 50%-55% is above a consensus of 48.6%, but the company also says its investment budget will increase by $60M-$70M Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 PM
  • FTI

    More on FMC Technologies (NYSE:FTI): Q4 beats on revenue but comes up short on a per share basis...

    More on FMC Technologies (NYSE:FTI): Q4 beats on revenue but comes up short on a per share basis as margins missed guidance due to higher project costs and expenses. The company also lowers 2012 guidance, now seeing its EPS between $2.10 - $2.25, below Street estimates for $2.26. Shares -3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:48 PM
  • ACAS

    More on American Capital (NASDAQ:ACAS): Q4 adjusted EPS blows away estimates, largely due to a...

    More on American Capital (NASDAQ:ACAS): Q4 adjusted EPS blows away estimates, largely due to a $428M deferred tax benefit recognized during the quarter. Shares +4.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM
  • VMI

    Valmont Industries (NYSE:VMI): Q4 EPS of $1.83 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $752.7M (+25.7% Y/Y)...

    Valmont Industries (NYSE:VMI): Q4 EPS of $1.83 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $752.7M (+25.7% Y/Y) beats by $72M. Shares +4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM
  • ARGO

    Argonaut Group (AGII): Q4 EPS of -$0.34 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $318.6M (flat Y/Y) beats by...

    Argonaut Group (AGII): Q4 EPS of -$0.34 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $318.6M (flat Y/Y) beats by $63M. Shares +2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • PEET

    More on Peet's Coffee's Q4: Growth driven by the company's grocery business, +29% Y/Y. Retail...

    More on Peet's Coffee's Q4: Growth driven by the company's grocery business, +29% Y/Y. Retail revenue up only 3% Y/Y, possibly a sign of tough competition from Starbucks. Cost of sales were 52.7% of revenue, up 700 bps Y/Y, mostly due to higher coffee costs. Peet's is guiding for 2012 revenue growth of 10% (9.9% consensus) and EPS of $1.70-$1.80 ($1.79 consensus). PEET -4.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACPW

    Active Power (NASDAQ:ACPW): Q4 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $18.3M (-5.2% Y/Y)...

    Active Power (NASDAQ:ACPW): Q4 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $18.3M (-5.2% Y/Y) misses by $1.6M. Shares -15.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM
  • SAPE

    Sapient (NASDAQ:SAPE): Q4 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $262.2M (+17.6% Y/Y) in-line....

    Sapient (NASDAQ:SAPE): Q4 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $262.2M (+17.6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • GLBR

    FXCM drops 4% AH after reporting retail customer trading volume of $298B (+15% Y/Y) and...

    FXCM drops 4% AH after reporting retail customer trading volume of $298B (+15% Y/Y) and institutional customer trading volume of $109B (+39% Y/Y). Retail tradeable accounts rose 1% Q/Q and 13% Y/Y, to 167.7K.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM
  • WLTW

    Willis Group (WSH): Q4 EPS of $0.46 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $825M (-1% Y/Y). Shares -1.7%...

    Willis Group (WSH): Q4 EPS of $0.46 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $825M (-1% Y/Y). Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM
  • CVI

    CVR Energy (CVI +2.5%), which rallied today thanks to a statement (I, II) from Carl Icahn...

    CVR Energy (CVI +2.5%), which rallied today thanks to a statement (I, II) from Carl Icahn calling for the company to sell itself, is up 1.3% AH after Icahn discloses a 3.8M share stake in his quarterly 13F.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • HIG

    John Paulson turns up the heat on Hartford Financial (NYSE:HIG) to break up the company,...

    John Paulson turns up the heat on Hartford Financial (NYSE:HIG) to break up the company, rebutting arguments from the insurer in favor of the status quo: "Shareholders are entitled to expect the management and the board to show leadership by moving beyond the current phase of identifying potential challenges to working actively to address them." HIG +5.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • HITT

    Hittite Microwave (NASDAQ:HITT): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $60.2M (-8,2% Y/Y)...

    Hittite Microwave (NASDAQ:HITT): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $60.2M (-8,2% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • MDT

    Given Imaging (GIVN): Q4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $48.5M (+8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Given Imaging (GIVN): Q4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $48.5M (+8% Y/Y) beats by $1.7M. Shares +11.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • ANIP

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) jumps 22.2% AH after Bloomberg reports the FDA has approved the...

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) jumps 22.2% AH after Bloomberg reports the FDA has approved the company's Bio-T Gel, which BioSante has licensed to Teva Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:TEVA). BioSante shares have been extremely volatile in recent months on account of drug-related news.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • MET

    More on MetLife (NYSE:MET): Q4 comes up short on revenue but beats solidly on a per share basis....

    More on MetLife (NYSE:MET): Q4 comes up short on revenue but beats solidly on a per share basis. Profit rose 19% Y/Y, driven by derivatives gains and solid international sales growth which was boosted by the company's acquisition of life-insurance unit Alico in 2010. Shares +3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers International (NYSE:WTW): Q4 EPS of $0.86 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $401.3M...

    Weight Watchers International (NYSE:WTW): Q4 EPS of $0.86 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $401.3M (+12.5% Y/Y) misses by $11M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • ACAS

    American Capital (NASDAQ:ACAS): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.04. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)

    American Capital (NASDAQ:ACAS): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.04. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • FTI

    FMC Technologies (NYSE:FTI): Q4 EPS of $0.41 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $1.5B (+36% Y/Y) beats...

    FMC Technologies (NYSE:FTI): Q4 EPS of $0.41 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $1.5B (+36% Y/Y) beats by $60M. Shares -3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) rises 1.9% AH after David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital discloses a...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) rises 1.9% AH after David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital discloses a 2.9M share stake in the struggling smartphone maker. Einhorn offered mildly positive remarks on RIM during a recent talk.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 4 Comments
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW) announces that it will launch a self-tender offer for $720M of its...

    Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW) announces that it will launch a self-tender offer for $720M of its common stock in a price range of $72 to $83. The company also says it will repurchase $1.5B worth of shares from its majority shareholder. Shares +4.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • ALEX

    Alexander & Baldwin (ALEX -7.2%) finishes the day lower following yesterday's Q4 EPS miss....

    Alexander & Baldwin (ALEX -7.2%) finishes the day lower following yesterday's Q4 EPS miss. Keefe Bruyette cut the shares to Market Perform on the news, citing valuation and a lack of catalysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • MET

    MetLife (NYSE:MET): Q4 EPS of $1.31 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $16.4B (+19% Y/Y) misses by...

    MetLife (NYSE:MET): Q4 EPS of $1.31 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $16.4B (+19% Y/Y) misses by $400M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • LL

    Janney cuts Lumber Liquidators (LL -4.7%) to Sell from Neutral, saying while the stock has risen...

    Janney cuts Lumber Liquidators (LL -4.7%) to Sell from Neutral, saying while the stock has risen 43% in three months on hopes of a cyclical housing recovery, the sales problem at the hardwood flooring retailer is structural, not cyclical. LL must "either stop growth, or continue to grow... and continue to disappoint on sales/earnings and preside over declining returns."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • AVP

    Avon (AVP +1.4%) shares swing higher after opening negative following a weak Q4 report....

    Avon (AVP +1.4%) shares swing higher after opening negative following a weak Q4 report. Investors apparently were reassured after outgoing CEO Andrea Jung pledged to let her successor take steps to cut costs without impediment and that the dividend is safe this year. AVP swung to a Q4 loss on a goodwill charge and softer revenue, but expectations already were low.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • NYCB

    New York Community Bancorp (NYB -1.8%) trades lower after being cut to Neutral at Guggenheim,...

    New York Community Bancorp (NYB -1.8%) trades lower after being cut to Neutral at Guggenheim, citing a more cautious outlook and increasing competition from new entrants.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • MYL

    Mylan (MYL +1%) gains on an upgrade to Buy from at Goldman, citing improved earnings visibility...

    Mylan (MYL +1%) gains on an upgrade to Buy from at Goldman, citing improved earnings visibility and an underestimated margin expansion led by the company's EpiPen product mix shift.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • ESRX

    Express Scripts (ESRX +4%) and Medco Health (MHS +2.9%) climb on a report the FTC is likely to...

    Express Scripts (ESRX +4%) and Medco Health (MHS +2.9%) climb on a report the FTC is likely to approve their merger deal, although a legal challenge remains possible. The issue is likely to be decided by FTC Chairman Jon Leibowitz, who worked as Sen. Herb Kohl's leading antitrust advisor for years, market intelligence journal MLex says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +4.2%) moves up on positive comments out of Credit Suisse today, saying its strong...

    Netflix (NFLX +4.2%) moves up on positive comments out of Credit Suisse today, saying its strong competitive position hasn't changed with the recent announcements by Verizon (VZ -0.9%) and Coinstar (CSTR -0.8%), or with Amazon.com's (AMZN -1.1%) streaming deal with Viacom (VIAB -0.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • GLNG

    Golar LNG (GLNG +5.4%) moves up after being mentioned positively at Dahlman Rose, saying the...

    Golar LNG (GLNG +5.4%) moves up after being mentioned positively at Dahlman Rose, saying the shipper is one of the best ways to play long-term trends in the LNG market.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Prime service has just 3-5M subscribers as of October, fewer than...

    Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Prime service has just 3-5M subscribers as of October, fewer than estimated, according to a Bloomberg report. The shares immediately dive nearly 3% on the news, before bouncing a bit. Analysts had estimated the current tally to be around 10M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO -5.5%), the closest thing Silicon Valley has to a soap opera, has fallen hard thanks...

    Yahoo (YHOO -5.5%), the closest thing Silicon Valley has to a soap opera, has fallen hard thanks to a report claiming Yahoo's Asian asset sales are in jeopardy due to tax issues. With Asian sources blaming Yahoo for "suddenly shifting course" on deal terms (likely the result of management and board changes), investors are choosing to price in a healthy amount of risk that the deal won't go through.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • RPXC

    RPX (RPXC +2%) gains on positive comments out of Cowen today, saying that any pullback in the...

    RPX (RPXC +2%) gains on positive comments out of Cowen today, saying that any pullback in the shares would be a buying opportunity. Cowen calls it a unique high growth story, citing its renewal rate, the monetization of its patents and its deal with Alcatel Lucent (ALU +3.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • TTM

    Shares of Tata Motors (TTM +6.2%) zoom higher after the automaker reports a 41% Y/Y profit gain...

    Shares of Tata Motors (TTM +6.2%) zoom higher after the automaker reports a 41% Y/Y profit gain for its FQ3, aided by sales in China and at its Jaguar-Land Rover unit. Revenue totaled 452.6B rupees ($8.5B), up 44%; profit was 34B rupees ($641.8M). Jaguar and Land Rover sales rose 37% to 86,322, "supported by the overwhelming response to the recently launched Range Rover Evoque."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • SYNM

    Syntroleum (SYNM +19.1%) shares jump after the company's Dynamic Fuels JV with Tyson Foods...

    Syntroleum (SYNM +19.1%) shares jump after the company's Dynamic Fuels JV with Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) inks a deal to supply renewable diesel fuel to Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC). SYNM says the contract shows customers are looking for renewable options that increase sustainability and lower emissions without sacrificing fuel quality.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARCH

    Arch Coal (ACI -3.3%) trades lower on a couple of downgrades today, reduced to Hold at Argus on...

    Arch Coal (ACI -3.3%) trades lower on a couple of downgrades today, reduced to Hold at Argus on weak coal fundamentals, and cut to Sector Perform at Iberia citing lower coking coal production and higher capex.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM

  • Shares of Post Holdings (POST +9.1%) show continued strength after the company spun off from...

    Shares of Post Holdings (POST +9.1%) show continued strength after the company spun off from Ralcorp earlier this month to trade on its own. The buzz on the firm focuses on its inclusion in the S&P 400 MidCap index and growing optimism from analysts that the cereal industry is rebounding.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • SHW

    Valspar (VAL +4.7%) shares hit an all-time high after the paint maker raises its 2012 profit...

    Valspar (VAL +4.7%) shares hit an all-time high after the paint maker raises its 2012 profit forecast and says it will continue to hike prices to offset rising raw materials costs. CEO Gary Hendrickson also rules the company out of bidding for the $3B coatings business DuPont (DD -2%) is looking to sell.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +6.5%), which has rallied strongly since Facebook filed its S-1, is making new...

    Zynga (ZNGA +6.5%), which has rallied strongly since Facebook filed its S-1, is making new post-IPO highs heading into today's Q4 report. Sterne Agee remains bearish (previously), arguing the Street's Q4 bookings expectations have gotten out of hand post-Facebook. However, Wedbush expects recent game launches to produce a Q4 beat and strong 2012 growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • IMAX

    IMAX (IMAX +7.8%) gets an added boost from positive comments out of Canaccord earlier today,...

    IMAX (IMAX +7.8%) gets an added boost from positive comments out of Canaccord earlier today, saying that mid-quarter box office receipts are tracking ahead of expectations and the firm believes its Q2 box office tally can reach $110M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • NSIT

    Insight Enterprises (NSIT +15.5%) pops after its Q4 beat estimates across the board. Net...

    Insight Enterprises (NSIT +15.5%) pops after its Q4 beat estimates across the board. Net earnings surged 39% Y/Y as the IT services company reported sharply higher sales in its Asia-Pacific region. The company also forecast upbeat 2012 outlook, expecting its EPS to come in between $2.20 - $2.30 per share. The Street is at $2.04 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • PERY

    Perry Ellis (PERY -4.4%) says it's launched a review of its brand portfolio, as the company has...

    Perry Ellis (PERY -4.4%) says it's launched a review of its brand portfolio, as the company has struggled in a highly competitive retail environment and from what its CEO calls a lack of "brand direction." The company also says a heavy promotional holiday season weighed on its profitability and projects a weak Q4 below analysts' projections.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • RAD

    Shares of Rite Aid (RAD +5.8%) kick up a healthy gain after the company announces that it will...

    Shares of Rite Aid (RAD +5.8%) kick up a healthy gain after the company announces that it will offer $481M in senior notes to help it repurchase higher-rate debt that is slated to come due in 2015. The bigger issue: Rite Aid is now up 26% YTD, standing in stark contrast to rival Walgreen's (WAG -1.1%) lagging 3.7% YTD gain as millions of Express Scripts customers fill prescriptions elsewhere.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • HAS

    Hasbro (HAS -0.4%) dips after reportedly talking down numbers in its management meeting...

    Hasbro (HAS -0.4%) dips after reportedly talking down numbers in its management meeting currently being held with UBS.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO -1.2%) talks to sell its Asian assets have been called off after hitting a...

    Yahoo (YHOO -1.2%) talks to sell its Asian assets have been called off after hitting a deal-breaking impasse over the efficacy of the centerpiece of the complex negotiation — a cash-rich split-off, according to reports from All Things D.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • SYK

    Stryker (SYK -0.7%) dips after being downgraded to Neutral on valuation at Lazard, citing the...

    Stryker (SYK -0.7%) dips after being downgraded to Neutral on valuation at Lazard, citing the lack of a new product cycle and the resignation of its CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • HTWR

    HeartWare (HTWR +1.9%) moves higher after an FDA panel says it will review the Premarket...

    HeartWare (HTWR +1.9%) moves higher after an FDA panel says it will review the Premarket Approval application for the company's Ventricular Assist System on April 25. Leerink Swann says the overhang in the shares has been removed following the news, and it believes a Q3 approval and launch is likely.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • BODY

    Body Central (OTCQB:BODY +2.5%) has a recession-resistant business model and should be bought at...

    Body Central (OTCQB:BODY +2.5%) has a recession-resistant business model and should be bought at current levels, says Oppenheimer. The firm raises its target price on the stock to $31 from $27.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • GKNT

    Geeknet (GKNT -10.3%), owner of Slashdot and other tech enthusiast sites, is off sharply after...

    Geeknet (GKNT -10.3%), owner of Slashdot and other tech enthusiast sites, is off sharply after reporting Q4 revenue of $59.8M (+20% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.95 ($0.75 in year-ago period). A 23% Y/Y increase in e-commerce revenue, largely from the company's ThinkGeek site, helped fuel growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • ASIA

    Its a game of tug-of-war with shares of AsiaInfo-Linkage (ASIA -2.7%) this morning after the...

    Its a game of tug-of-war with shares of AsiaInfo-Linkage (ASIA -2.7%) this morning after the company posted mixed Q4 results following yesterday's close. The stock initially rose over 7% in pre-market trading, only to give it all back plus more after the open. Adding to the confusion, Jefferies cuts the shares to Hold after the report, citing margin pressure, while Roth raises its rating to Buy on the company's privatization efforts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • FOSL

    Fossil (FOSL +7.1%) shares bounce strongly after an early drop following Q4 results that...

    Fossil (FOSL +7.1%) shares bounce strongly after an early drop following Q4 results that exceeded EPS estimates but missed on revenues. Investors decide they like the outlook for EPS of $5.40-$5.50 FY2012 and $0.90-$0.92 Q1, and 15% revenue gains for both the quarter and year, which implies $2.96B in FY2012 and $617.3M in Q1.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • GLDD

    Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (GLDD +9.3%) soars after announcing it will take part in a $1.21B...

    Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (GLDD +9.3%) soars after announcing it will take part in a $1.21B liquefied natural gas (LNG) dredging project in Australia, from which Great Lakes expects to derive at least $180M in revenue. D.A. Davidson is responding to the news by upgrading Great Lakes to Buy, arguing the deal will boost its 2013 earnings and provide "improved visibility."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • HFC

    HollyFrontier (HFC +4%) is upgraded to Conviction Buy with a target price raised to $49 from $36...

    HollyFrontier (HFC +4%) is upgraded to Conviction Buy with a target price raised to $49 from $36 at Goldman Sachs, which cites its "constructive Mid-Continent refining view and a best-in-class, pure-play Mid-Continent asset base," a more diverse Cushing footprint, a commitment to returning excess cash to shareholders, and superior capital project and re-investment opportunities.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +9%) gets a bounce from positive comments out of Roth Capital this...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +9%) gets a bounce from positive comments out of Roth Capital this morning, saying that shares should be bought on weakness following company's disclosure that an FDA panel had raised some concerns about the safety of its Northera Parkinson’s disease treatment. Roth says the concerns are no real surprise, and it still expects a positive outcome for the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • YGE

    Volatile solar stocks head lower (TAN -5.9%) thanks to a combination of bearish Deutsche...

    Volatile solar stocks head lower (TAN -5.9%) thanks to a combination of bearish Deutsche commentary about German subsidy cuts, and Auriga's downgrades of Yingli Green Energy (YGE -8.3%), Trina Solar (TSL -8.2%), and JinkoSolar (JKS -7.6%). Auriga notes the industry's costs haven't yet caught up with the massive price declines seen in 2011, and doesn't expect any profits before Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • ENER

    Trading resumes in Energy Conversion Devices (NASDAQ:ENER) with a 81% drop following the firm's...

    Trading resumes in Energy Conversion Devices (NASDAQ:ENER) with a 81% drop following the firm's bankruptcy filing. Shares of the solar industry supplier now trade at $0.28 - after once flying high at over $79.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • MDRX

    Sterne Agee says Allscripts (MDRX +2.4%) is going to beat estimates and should be bought ahead...

    Sterne Agee says Allscripts (MDRX +2.4%) is going to beat estimates and should be bought ahead of Q4 results. The clinical software provider is benefiting from a number of strong positive catalysts due to regulatory changes in the healthcare industry, and the upcoming guidance is likely to reflect that. Additionally, the stock's been suffering from a valuation gap with its peers, which should narrow over time.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • GT

    Goodyear (GT -8.7%) shares burst following its Q4 earnings, with the tire maker forecasting...

    Goodyear (GT -8.7%) shares burst following its Q4 earnings, with the tire maker forecasting slowing gobal demand and warning it faces increases of 20%-25% in raw-material costs in Q1. The fall in Goodyear's stock price comes despite the company posting its first annual profit in three years.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • HSP

    Hospira (HSP +7.2%) shares power ahead after the specialty pharmaceutical company's Q4 adjusted...

    Hospira (HSP +7.2%) shares power ahead after the specialty pharmaceutical company's Q4 adjusted EPS from ongoing operations came in at $0.51 and revenues hit $1.01B, both topping expectations. CEO Michael Ball says a factory cited for manufacturing problems had reopened and was nearing previous production levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • MAS

    Masco (MAS -13%) tanks after its Q4 misses estimates on weaker sales. Revenue was slightly...

    Masco (MAS -13%) tanks after its Q4 misses estimates on weaker sales. Revenue was slightly higher due continued cost-cutting efforts, up 2% Y/Y, but not enough to compensate for rising commodity prices and a slowdown in its European sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -3%) is up 48% YTD, but Citigroup thinks the rally may be getting ahead of...
